comments.content:
_He's everywhere! He's everywhere!_ (Old 'Chicken Man' tag line).   
   
May you be around for at least 5,000 more.

Congratulations, Yves!   
   
Just out of curiosity, when was your first post and what was it about?

Here's to Yves, a true Typophile.   
   
Watch out buddy - I'm catching up ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050515203647im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
 - Lex

\> My very first post   
   
Excellent. And it was all downhill from there, apparently. ;-)   
   
Kent, I'm afraid, has succumbed to a sense of proportion. :-)

![5000yves](http://web.archive.org/web/20050515203647im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/70555.gif)   
   
_( I know, I am probably 11 or more posts late.. I wanted to post this right after your 5000th post, but, sadly enough, I was away today, so there you go.. Go, Yves, Go, Yves.. ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050515203647im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif) )_
It's sweet seeing baby Yves learn how to make his first hyperlink. They grow up so fast...

\>Whoa!? I'm art!   
   
Not just art, POP ART!   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050515203647im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/70558.jpg)

Dav, how appropriate that you used Eclat on your poster. Was the other lettering Avenir?   
   
Jan, please, what is that script?

Mike, the script that Jan used is one of [Rob Leuschke's](http://web.archive.org/web/20050515203647/http:/www.myfonts.com/browse/foundry/gideon/?idtype=foundry&itemsperpage=37&resultcount=37&page=1)   
splendid fonts ï¿½ this one called [Water Brush](http://web.archive.org/web/20050515203647/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/gideon/water-brush/regular/testdrive.html?s=Yves+Peters&p=48).   
   
Impressive, Yves!

Nice one, Jan.. _( Yves, Type ID'ers are the new PopStars.. )_   
   
_Yea, Stephen and Mike, Its 'DIN' and 'Eclat', and, you may have guessed it, these may be some of the 'Most Wanted' type ID requests, here on Typophile, so what would be more appropriate.?_ ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050515203647im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif)
